Generation IV.Diamond: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
Generation IV.Pearl: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
Generation IV.Platinum: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
Generation IV.HeartGold: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.

Generation V.Black: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
Generation V.White: Heedless of enemy attacks, it closes in, shoves its tails onto the foe, then looses high voltage.
Generation V.Black 2: The instant it presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent, it sends over 20,000 volts of electricity into the foe.
Generation V.White 2: The instant it presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent, it sends over 20,000 volts of electricity into the foe.

Generation VI.X: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
Generation VI.Y: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: As its electric charge amplifies, blue sparks begin to crackle between its horns.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of power.

Generation VII.Sun: It pushes the tips of its tails against its foes and then lets loose a high-voltage current. Its foes are burned to a crisp in an instant.
Generation VII.Moon: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: It grips its tail, which spews electricity, and then beats down opponents with the power of its electrified fist.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: A single Electivire can provide enough electricity for all the buildings in a big city for a year.

Generation VIII.Sword: The amount of electrical energy this Pokémon produces is proportional to the rate of its pulse. The voltage jumps while Electivire is battling.
Generation VIII.Shield: In terms of electrical-energy output, Electivire is one of the best among all Electric Pokémon. It discharges high-voltage currents from its tails.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of electricity.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It pushes the tips of its two tails against the foe, then lets loose with over 20,000 volts of electricity.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.

Generation IX.Scarlet: When it gets excited, it thumps its chest. With every thud, thunder roars and electric sparks shower all around.
Generation IX.Violet: This Pokémon presses the tips of its tails onto an opponent and instantly sends over 20,000 volts of high-voltage electricity through them.
